meanings.definition: The distance or measurement from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The classroom had a large breadth, making it easy for students to move around.
meanings.sent2: The breadth of the river was too wide to jump across.
meanings.sent3: The breadth of the cake was so wide that it barely fit in the oven.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge had a breadth as vast as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The breadth of the canyon was breathtaking, stretching as far as the eye could see.

meanings.definition: The extent or scope of something.
meanings.sent1: The breadth of his responsibilities at work was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: She was amazed by the breadth of the library's book collection.
meanings.sent3: The breadth of his appetite for pizza was legendary among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The breadth of her creativity knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The breadth of the universe is beyond human comprehension.
